videos.description:
The productivity of every farm in Kenya is dependent on the potential of the soils in each field to grow crops.
Long term and repeated use of nitrogen-based fertilizers in the maize growing zones of Western Kenya has resulted in high soil acidity reducing farm productivity. 
Recent introduction of the use of lime to reduce soil acidity has resulted in dramatic improvement in maize yield.
This video shows how farmers in Western Kenya have recorded improved productivity due to use of Agricultural Lime.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: The Importance of Agricultural Lime: Evidence from Western Kenya

videos.description: Over 3,000 farmers and 40 stakeholders in agriculture converged at Wang‚Äôuru stadium in Mwea on 24th June 2016, for an Agribusiness Expo. The Expo was organised by New Down Town Ltd (A leading Agri Input Distributor based in Mwea) in partnership with Kenya Markets Trust (KMT) and Kirinyaga County Government.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Mwea Agribusiness Expo

videos.description: MbeguChoice is an online tool which helps farmers, agrodealers, and extension workers identify the crop seed varieties in the market which breeders think may meet their specific needs. ‚ÄúMbegu‚Äù means ‚Äúseed‚Äù in Kiswahili.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: MbeguChoice Portal

videos.description:
Gatsby Africa (formerly through Kenya Markets Trust) supported Kenya Livestock Marketing Council (KLMC) develop a market information system that will be used to collect market price information from the livestock markets. The information will be disseminated to the different players in the livestock sector. 
KLMC is a membership-based organization of livestock producers, traders, processors and other players in the livestock sector in arid and semi-arid areas of Kenya.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Information portal helps pastoralists get the much needed market information

videos.description:
Despite the importance of agriculture to the Kenyan economy, it has not been performing to its potential. There is limited diversification away from staple crops, such as maize, and average yields remaining below those of comparable countries. Kenyan farmers use relatively low levels of inputs. This lowers productivity and therefore farmers‚Äô returns and their ability to reinvest in their crops.
This video demonstrates our successes in improving access to and use of quality agricultural among smallholder farmers in Kenya.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Improving Access to and Use of Quality Agricultural Inputs

videos.description: We are encouraging farmers to use lime-based fertilizers to reduce soil acidity and improve nutrient uptake by crops. The ultimate goal is to increase farmer productivity so as to increase Kenya's food security.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Farmers Benefit From Use of Lime-Based Fertilizer

videos.description: Conservation agriculture is one of the best technologies to use in your farm especially if you live in an arid areas.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Conservation Agriculture Helping Farmers in Makueni Earn Incomes

videos.description:
Kirinyaga County is home for Horticulture farming which is a key foreign exchange earner in Kenya. Agricultural accounts for 65% of the total export earnings in Kenya with horticulture being the largest agricultural sub-sector contributing about 33% of the Agricultural GDP and 38% of export earnings
Despite this critical importance, farmers have increasingly faced a ban on their export produce due to non-compliance with maximum residue levels in the agrochemicals they use. Export markets continue to increase standards regulating chemical residue levels leading to the ban of commonly used pesticides or severe restriction of their use. This move has negatively affected export earnings.
Gatsby Africa (formerly through Kenya Markets Trust) organized a business luncheon at Mwea Guest House where about 80 input subsector stakeholders deliberated on ‚ÄúEffects of noncompliance with Maximum Residue Levels to the horticultural sub-sector in Kirinyaga County and Kenya as a whole‚Äù. Watch the video to learn more.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Compliance to Maximum Residue Levels to Unlock Horticulture Produce Exports Markets

videos.description:
Gatsby Africa (formerly through Kenya Markets Trust) has been pushing for Kenya's meat industry to modernise and meet international food quality and safety standards throughout the meat processing sub-sector. We have begun to see the fruits of this labour, with companies meeting various certifications that have opened avenues to increased sales, positive consumer satisfaction, and reduced wastage and losses, among other benefits.
Listen in to the impact of our work in building stronger and more inclusive beef market systems while impacting thousands of lives.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Catalysing Uptake of Global Food Safety Standards in Kenya

videos.description: Since 2011, Gatsby Africa (formerly through Kenya Markets Trust) has worked to improve the lives of millions of Kenyans by facilitating the development of better market systems.
videos.subtitle: Greenlife Protection
videos.title: Building Sustainable and Inclusive Markets

videos.description: Gatsby Africa (formerly through Kenya Markets Trust) is promoting the adoption of bio-pesticides by smallholder farmers to advance climate-smart agricultural practices and safe use of pesticides to enhance compliance with food safety standards. This will increase incomes and food security in the country.
videos.subtitle: Gatsby Africa
videos.title: Access and Use of Biopesticides in Kenya

videos.description:
Amiran Agronomist Timothy Munyoki and Dorcas Nderitu explain more on why the The Amiran Farmers Kit allows small-scale farmers affordable access to modern agricultural technologies, methods and inputs of the highest standard. 
Designed by Amiran Kenya, the AFK is a tailor-made Kit designed to meet the needs of the specific farmer or group of farmers by adapting the components of the Kit to suit the climate, terrain, and agricultural experience of the farmer.
videos.subtitle: Amiran
videos.title: Affordable Access to Modern Farming with The Amiran Farmers Kit

videos.title: Clement Metho Anatueleza Kwa Nini Maridadi F1 ni Aina Nzuri ya Tikiti Maji

videos.description:
People are reaching for tools - new and old - to produce more food with less water. We advice that as a farmer you adopt precise irrigation practices, in this case: DRIP IRRIGATION.
Featured: Shanty Improved grown under drip irrigation.
For more information on our irrigation equipment and seeds contact us on our toll free number 0800720720
www.amirankenya.com
videos.subtitle: Amiran
videos.title: Reduce Water Usage by Use of Drip Irrigation Systems

videos.description: Fall armyworm is a major invasive pest with a voracious appetite; its ability to spread and reproduce quickly is one of the reasons it is such a successful invasive species.
videos.subtitle: CABI Invasives
videos.title: Fall Armyworm Life Cycle

videos.description:
Bridging the gap by ensuring farmers in Africa have access to world-class innovations, our agricultural basket of products includes chemicals, fertilizers, seeds, modern irrigation systems, greenhouse kits, plastics and covers in addition to services such as training, agro-support, on call support assistance and growing guides. The changing weather patterns and emergence of new pests and diseases in the agricultural field has challenged us to continuously research and introduce a range of products to cater to these needs. 
Our core goal is to reduce risks and make farming a simple and rewarding venture by providing farmers with all that is needed for a successful harvest.
videos.subtitle: Amiran
videos.title: Why Amiran Likes Working With Farmers

videos.description:
Maximus is both for Pre and Early Post-emergence. 
Can be applied IP to the 2nd or 3rd leaf stage (maize). 
Kills both Grasses and Broadleaved Weeds leaving your maize crop from weeds competition.
Rate: 300ml/20L: 3L/Ha
videos.subtitle: Amiran
videos.title: Learn About MAXIMUS, Selective Herbicide for Maize

videos.description: Koppert Biological Systems has several sticky traps available for monitoring and trapping pests in a wide variety of crops. This video shows you how to apply Horiver Delta in your crop.   With its large sticky surface area, Horiver Delta has glue on both sides of the card and can be folded into a large trap. Apply a pheromone dispenser to the inside of this trap and pests can be caught on both surfaces of this trap designed for flying insects. For more information about Horiver Delta visit: www.koppert.co.ke/horiver-delta
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Horiver Delta from Koppert

videos.description: Koppert Biological Systems has several sticky traps available for monitoring and trapping pests in a wide variety of crops. This video shows you how to apply Horiver Disc in your crop.   Round in shape, Horiver Disc has been designed to fit around the stem of a plant ‚Äì ideal to trap pests active both above and below the ground. It has been specially adapted to trap root aphids and fungus gnats and has two attachment points for drip irrigation. It is very suitable for cannabis cultivation. For more information about Horiver Disc visit: www.koppert.co.ke/horiver-disc
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Horiver Disc from Koppert

videos.description: Koppert Biological Systems has several sticky traps available for monitoring and trapping pests in a wide variety of crops. This video shows you how to apply Horiver Dry in your crop.   As the glue on the Horiver Dry sticky trap leaves no staining, users might experience this card more user-friendly. Depending on colour, it is effective for a number of pests, including thrips and sciarids. The yellow card is extremely attractive to the harmful Nesidiocoris bug. For more information about Horiver Dry visit: www.koppert.co.ke/horiver-dry
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Horiver Dry from Koppert

videos.description: Koppert Biological Systems has several sticky traps available for monitoring and trapping pests in a wide variety of crops. This video shows you how to apply Horiver Wet in your crop.   Depending on colour, the Horiver Wet sticky trap has been designed specifically for the monitoring of adult aphids, whitefly, thrips, Tuta absoluta, fruit flies and sciarids. Its ultra-sticky glue provides large sticky surfaces and capturing capacity. It has a proven above-average score for catching whitefly. For more information about Horiver Wet visit: www.koppert.co.ke/horiver-wet
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Horiver Wet from Koppert

videos.description: Use Spical-Plus for biological pest control of two spotted spider mite. Introduce Spical-Plus if pest presence is suspected or at the first sign of pest presence. This video shows you how to apply Spical-Plus in your crop.
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Spical-Plus in a potato crop from Koppert - biological control

videos.description: Use Spidex for biological pest control of two spotted spider mite (Tetranychus urticae). Spidex works well on all the life cycle stages of the two-spotted spider mite but prefers younger stages most. Use Spidex preventatively and at the first sign of pest presence. This video shows you how to apply Spidex in your crop.
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Spidex from Koppert

videos.description: The Mini-Airbug hand-held blower is especially developed for the rapid and even distribution of natural enemies. This uniform distribution leads to an effective biological pest control, because the mites reach the pest faster. The Mini-Airbug is extremely flexible in use; the device can be used to apply predatory mites to the entire crop, or to a specific area. Several kinds of predatory mites can be released during a single session. For more information about the MIni-Airbug visit: www.koppert.co.ke/mini-airbug/
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use the Mini-Airbug from Koppert

videos.description: Soil borne diseases are a rapidly increasing problem for growers. Causing significant crop losses all around the world. Koppert works together with nature to assist growers to overcome these kind of problems with biological solutions that contribute to a more sustainable agriculture and horticulture. Trianum, a product based on the fungus Trichoderma harzianum T22,  is such a solution, it prevents, and controls soil borne diseases. With the Trianum-G tool it‚Äôs now even easier to apply the product at the beginning of the crop cycle.
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: Trianum-G Tool: Dose Your Trianum-G Efficient and Equal at the Beginning of the Growing Season

videos.description: Vidi Funda is a natural and organic soil improver based on raw materials. The product contains a unique combination of amino-acids which support the development of a diverse soil population of beneficial microbes, especially fungi. By improving the overall soil health, as well as supplying plant-based organic nutrients, research and commercial applications have shown an increase in available nitrogen from mineralization. Following mineralization, the plant can easily absorb the nutrients from the Vidi Funda, which reduces leaching.
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Vidi Funda from Koppert

videos.description: Use Spidex Vital for biological pest control of two spotted spider mite (Tetranychus urticae). Spidex Vital works well on all the life cycle stages of the two-spotted spider mite but prefers younger stages most. Use Spidex Vital preventatively and at the first sign of pest presence.
videos.subtitle: Koppert
videos.title: How to use Spidex Vital from Koppert
